Health Care Enforcement Reflections And Forecasts: Part 2

Law360, New York (January 25, 2016, 2:56 PM ET) -- Hope S. Foster



Laurence J. Freedman



Bridget M. Rohde In part 1 of this three-part series we recapped the 2015 policy developments that will impact health care fraud enforcement going forward. Here, in part 2, we review some of last year's notable cases and criminal prosecutions.



Criminal Prosecutions



Medicare Fraud and Related Offenses

article_metadata.description: In 2015, we saw several notable cases and criminal prosecutions in the health care fraud arena. A close look at these cases helps to explain the U.S. Department of Justice's decision-making process regarding the type of action it might consider given the circumstances of a case, say attorneys at Mintz Levin Cohn Ferris Glovsky and Popeo PC.
